description:
Metarhizium acridum is an entomopathogenic fungus, meaning it is a fungus that can infect and kill insects. It is a species of the genus Metarhizium, which is known for its ability to infect and control various agricultural pests.

Metarhizium acridum is particularly effective against locust and grasshopper species, which can be devastating agricultural pests in many parts of the world. The fungus is able to infect these insects through their cuticle, the outer layer of their exoskeleton. Once inside the insect, the fungus grows and multiplies, eventually killing the host.

The spores of Metarhizium acridum are often used as a biological control agent, as they can be applied to crops or grasslands to help manage locust and grasshopper populations. This method of pest control is considered more environmentally friendly than the use of synthetic chemical pesticides.

Metarhizium acridum is found naturally in various regions around the world, and its use as a biopesticide has been extensively studied and implemented in many countries, particularly in Africa and Asia, where locust and grasshopper infestations can have a significant impact on agricultural production.
